Software Stuff - Git Remote Add Upstream Tweet

So usually I just follow twiki recipes prepared by more senior scientists. I don’t usually question what the lines and command mean but I should be more critical now! I’m usually happy as long as it works! There’s this line that I’ve seen multiple times. Looks like this:


git remote add upstream https://:@gitlab.cern.ch:somerepo.git.

Looking at the ever helpful stackoverflow you use this command if you want to update your forked git repo with the latest changes in the original repo you forked. It’s pretty handy. Now I won’t forget it.
